intro: Cliffortia ramosissima, commonly known as the many-branched starling's-tail, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, known for its characteristic pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers make it a distinctive and ornamental species. It is also valued for its ability to thrive in harsh environments, making it a resilient choice for gardens in Mediterranean climates.
